website_summaries.verdict: Even the tiniest bundles of joy need diapers, but it's not always easy to find cloth diapers small enough to fit them. Rumparooz newborn/preemie size diapers are for babies as small as 4 lbs., and can be snapped to grow with baby up to 15 lbs.
pros: Use your favorite prefold or fitted plain cotton diaper underneath this waterproof, stain-resistant, and comfortably soft cover
Solvent-free polyester is nontoxic and less harmful to the environment than regular polyester
cons: More expensive than diaper covers for larger babies

customer_reviews.title: Leaks around tag/label
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Rumparooz diaper covers for 8 months. Do not buy. Elastics are fine and good condition. It would be a good diaper but they have stupidly sewn the label through the PUL damaging the PUL. There are always leaks around where the brand label is sewn. As you can see in my photo, the area around the label is saturated.
customer_reviews.author: NYCmom

customer_reviews.title: Not so much for the chunky baby
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wipe out as it is all a plasticity material. The buttons are reinforced with another piece for material which is great for the buttons but it is not sown down to anything making a perfect pocket for baby bm it can be cleaned but has lead to a couple stains since I didn't see/get it off fast enough. My child is also very chunky and the extra elastic I loved when she was a newborn now seems to cut in to her it leaves red marks on her skin after changing so maybe not so great if you got a little chunk
customer_reviews.author: Geronimo

customer_reviews.title: Either mistake Rumparoo cover, old cheap version or knockoff.
customer_reviews.text: Seller was quick with shipping and probably has no idea that the quality is way off with this product. Thisspecific cover is such a cheap cover. Thin thin thin waterproof fabric, awful snaps that almost rip the diaper to unsnap. And the material is almost tissue paper thin. Not sure how it will hold up with liquids and 💩. And what's odd is that in the care directions, Wash is spelled was. Campared to the Billy newborn cover which we bought this makes so sad and dissappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shops too much

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite diaper cover.
customer_reviews.text: I have always heard such good things about Rumparooz, but I can't say that I agree. This cover is always a the back of the queue of available covers, and usually gets skipped if it happens to find it's way to the front. The only snaps on the back are at the far edges of the tabs, so we find that the wings on the front of the diaper usually droop down LO's legs, causing poor fit and leaks. He honestly hasn't worn it long enough to experience leaking around the tag, but that doesn't seem like a very logical choice of placement on something that is supposed to be waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: AshleySheridan

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Patters and Excellent Quality! Over a year and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Almost my entire cloth diaper stash is rumparooz! I've been cloth diapering for a year now and ALL of my rumparooz are still going strong. I've had ZERO issues with stink/stain/leaks or fit issues as my little girl has grown. 4 other diaper brands did not make it this far with me but I continue to buy Rumparooz! Adorable patterns and excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Mae

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I use prefolds and have been using thirsties covers- wanted to try out the rumparooz because sometimes the thirsties covers are wet around the leg holes after one change. So far the rumparooz has been dry and I could use the same cover all day.
customer_reviews.author: ak83

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cover!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite brand....My son was born at 4.9 lbs. They say they go down to 4 lbs, but good luck with that. They swallowed my son, and he could not wear them comfortably until about 7-8 lbs. He had to wear disposable diapers. Still though, I didn't have any leaks in these diapers or accidents. I did in the disposables. I have bum genius, thirsties, best bottom, and buttons diaper covers, and these are my favorite. I will only be buying this brand for larger sizes. Best bottom and buttons are horrible fits and leaks. The thirsties material absorbs the urine, so you have to change the cover with every diaper change, which defeats the purpose in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Good for babies with skinny legs!
customer_reviews.text: We used this for my daughter with x-small Imagine Baby prefolds (side note, those are great, too) since her umbilical cord fell off. She was a small baby (under 6 lbs), and had skinny legs but we never got leaks. It has a double leg gusset, but only the inner one was snug, but it still seemed to work just fine for us. At 4 months we still use these (she's still under 12 lbs), and the outer gusset is still not snug so I'm not sure if there's some crazy way to adjust it that I don't know about, or if her legs are just that small.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Adorbs, but leaky
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is a COVER, so not absorbent (amazon asked how absorbent it was). It was great when my baby was brand new....but within 2 weeks it had sprung a leak. Not at all useful for my now 2 week old baby, and that was before the real peeing started. Had to retire it. I'm saving it (I bought 2) for my next baby, just in case it just needs to stick with newborns only (and I know it worked with the umbilical cord present).
customer_reviews.author: Chanjin

customer_reviews.title: disappointing! awkward fit - pinching and bunching
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this cover so much - I looked at a lot and read reviews and needed to buy another couple to top off my supply. This one had the cutest design (beehive!) - but the functionality of this leaves a lot to be desired. - when snapped up to be smaller, so much of the material bunches up and makes it awkward, and weirdly pinchy around the legs. The closure snaps leave the loose flaps sticking out awkwardly around waist. There is too much skinny elastic in waistband - digs into skin! If the fit is loosened a bit it’s WAY too loose all around. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Carter

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold any moisture.
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this diaper again. I had a major problem with the pul. Every time the prefold got wet so did the entire outside of the diaper. It did not hold moisture at all. I only used this diaper as an emergency diaper when all my other ones were in the wash, and I planned on getting urine on me when she wore it. I am glad I only bought one.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Figger

customer_reviews.title: Great with Prefolds
customer_reviews.text: This is the best diaper cover over our Osocozy prefolds. We starting using the OS as soon as the cord stump fell off when baby was just about 8lbs. Only one of our one size diaper products that fit baby when she was newborn. She is 3 months and over 12 lbs now and the diaper cover does still peek out the leg holes of her onesies, but it doesn't look bulky with pants over it. We still have to fold some excess fabric from the prefolds at the top and these are the only diaper covers that feel secure over the extra bump. We haven't had any leaks. They dry fast on the line.
customer_reviews.author: Sam O

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: First time buying rumparooz brand cover and third cloth diapered baby. By far this has been the worst cover I've ever purchased. Every single time I used this cover it would leak form either the legs or the back. I tried different forms of inserts with this cover and every time it was a fail. I have other brand covers that are 8 years old that are still holding up strong. This cover was a huge waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: They are great for keeping the mess in with the leg gussets
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of the Rumparooz diaper covers!! They are great for keeping the mess in with the leg gussets. They are easy to clean and fast drying and not as bulky as the competitors. The best thin about them is you can use the same one through out the day with out it getting super wet between changes. Just wipe it out and its ready. I really enjoy the solid colors and the fun print designs they have. They are a must have if you are doing the pre-fold cloth diapering system!!
customer_reviews.author: Fairydazy

customer_reviews.title: My Fav CD Cover
customer_reviews.text: I have several different cloth diapers, I have Fuzzibuns, Thirsties, Babyland, Bumgenius, Gro-Via and some handmade wool ones. By far, the Rumparooz covers are best for me. They are a little more work, since you have to use a Snapi and the old school cloth, but I don't care. They don't leak! I have never had a leak with these diapers, not once. All the other ones I have mentioned leaked, even with adjusting them several different times over and over again. In cloth diapering though, you have to go with what works best for your baby and family, and these do it for us. I use the OsoCozy prefolds that Amazon also sells.
customer_reviews.author: Toma

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but compression leaks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: i love the tight fit of this cover for my skinny newborn. It is easy to get a good fit on the legs so I didn't have any leaks or gaps from there. It is very trim and the colors are nice. Cons: every time I had this on my baby for more than an hour it leaked around the tag sewn in the back. Customer service suggested I needed more absorption but I can use the same prefold with a Thirsties cover for over two hours with no leaks. I got a refund and will stick with Thirsties.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend!! Only covers you’ll need!
customer_reviews.text: I love these!!! They are my favorite brand. I had a friend who had different types of covers and these were by far my favorite. I got a bunch from my registry. They have a great liner inside so if the diapers just a wet diaper, i reuse the cover. I hang dry them though so that they will last longer for the future. The snaps are great. She gave me some of her covers that she’s had for 2 kids. And the quality is practically still like new! So I’d say that’s an indication of the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper covers I've ever used, have used them for 3 years now and we're now into potty training, so will be putting them away soon. Other than one or two covers with stretched out elastic, they've retained their shape, leak-proof ability, and just really withstood a lot of use quite well! We only had a total of about 7 of these covers for our entire time cloth-diapering, from birth to now. And I'm horrible with air-drying, so that's including washing machine and dryer abuse.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: cute and thick
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this product but I wish I had gone with the hook and loop instead,in general my hands are hurting from life and these button snaps don't help but it was a great product seemed thicker than other brands I have tried and I thought the pattern was insanely cute,I wasn't sure if it would be a great pattern for a boy but the color is like a dark coral and i was happy with it and the contrasting light blue was wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Becca Faith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good buy
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty good, no as great as the flips or thirsties but they hold up ok. No leaks, just found that the front is a little too scrunched up and doesn’t stretch as easily as other covers. But so far I like them well enough. I read all complaints but found mine to be pretty good, not too much to coplain about except what I mentioned about the front.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Leaky! Lasts about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked these, especially the cost. My biggest complaint was the tag in the back often leaked. Six months later I find these are simply not durable. We don’t have blowouts, but a heavy wet leaks through the material. Basically it is no longer waterproof. I have three, that are all prone to leaking after six months of using. I do not dry them, I do not bleach them. They just aren’t made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Carole B

customer_reviews.title: Really soft material and relatively good for leaks
customer_reviews.text: As these are just the outer shell its hard to comment on absorption as that depends on the insert. The material is easy to clean and very soft. There is a rubber tag on the back that I thought might be uncomfortable, but I doubt my son notices once an insert is used.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Can use all day and we use them over disposables
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used these for many years and still like them. They’re not completely leak proof if the diaper is saturated. But if you change the diaper (prefold) often enough you can use these covers all day! On our third child we burned out using cloth diapers and switched to disposable ones (sorry environment) but we buy the cheapest kind and put these covers over. it helps keep any blow-outs contained and prevents saggy diaper problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Traps in moisture
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a baby shower for a friend who was deteremined to cloth diaper. She loved the cloth diaper but didn’t use this after a few time because it trapped in moisture and she was worried about diaper rash. She got a wool diaper cloth instead and was very happy with that. That’s not to say the product doesn’t do exactly was it was designed to do but maybe if they transitioned to a breathable fabric it would be better for their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: TPU Lining Wears Out
customer_reviews.text: I loved these covers until recently. I've been using them for just over a year now and they started leaking before every diaper change. I noticed that most of my Rumparooz have developed cracks in the TPU lining. I have some Flip covers I've been using for over three years straight and some Thirsties and Peachy Greens that all get washed the same way, but I haven't had any problems with the PUL lining of the other brands. Such a waste if they won't even keep one child diapered until potty training!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional diapers
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are some of the best I’ve tried. I’ve cloth diapered for years and only recently came across these covers and wish I would have found them Years ago! They are soft, easy to use, durable and so pretty! The prints and colors are the best! Cute, simple to use, and great for baby and for our planet!
customer_reviews.author: RunningMartha

customer_reviews.title: Great shell for prefold cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: These shells came highly recommended to me by a friend and I am so glad I went with them. I have been very pleased with how easy these make it to cloth diaper without having to pack pouches. I am especially pleased with their ability to prevent blow outs. These have saved quite a few outfits!
customer_reviews.author: student

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small newborn!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this diaper cover! I purchased a couple of these for my 6lb newborn after she was born, since the "one size" covers of a different brand that I had previously purchased were huge and so bulky on her. So grateful that these small size covers were available as they work perfectly! Not too bulky and we haven't experienced any leaking yet after a month of using them. I use these with prefolds. They are also so cute, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The PUL is nice and thick, no poop explosions yet with this one thanks to the double gusset legholes, and it's nicely sized that it still fits my 10.5 pounder on some of the smaller settings. I'm rating it 4 stars because I thought the front would dip enough for a cord stump and it did not, which meant I couldn't use it in my sons first week of life. Since its a newborn cover, I would think it should be able to be used comfortably from birth. But all in all I'm impressed and I'd recommend this cover and I'm likely to buy another rumparooz product in the future
customer_reviews.author: Mainer Girl

customer_reviews.title: A must have for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: We adore these diaper covers. We have purchased many and are thrilled with the quality. The colors and prints are vivid and saturated! These wash and wear well. We love the adjustable snaps. They are high quality, providing ease in a custom fit. They never pinch or squeeze our babe and never leave red marks. Most importantly, they contain everything! We have never had a leak or a blow out! They cut down on clothing changes and save our car seat from getting soiled. A must have for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.author: emmab

customer_reviews.title: Soft but damp and leaky covers
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what all the hype about rumparooz is about. I love how soft the fabric is but that's about it. I don't get as good a fit with these as with any of my other brands of covers. They get feeling damp easily so I never use one twice in a row. I always trade out with another cover to let this one dry. I have wicking issues, and worst of all... it leaks through the back where the logo is sewn on.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbie Amir

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for us..
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these already and this one I ordered was the third. They work perfectly for us. I use them with FST flats or Cloth-Eez prefolds from GMD. I think they’re a wider and better fit than the thirsties duo snap and I prefer these ones over those. My 1 year old is 25lbs and uses the last rise of snaps so there’s still plenty of room to grow in to.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Gussets too tight...
customer_reviews.text: the inner gusset leaves red marks on baby's thighs no matter how I set the diaper. Compared to other diapers, the gussets on this one are too tensioned. My baby is 13 lbs; from the way the gussets fit on now at 4 moths, I do not see this diaper fitting anywhere near comfortable on a 1 year old baby. Returning it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are great for keeping the mess in with the leg gussets
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of the Rumparooz diaper covers!! They are great for keeping the mess in with the leg gussets. They are easy to clean and fast drying and not as bulky as the competitors. The best thin about them is you can use the same one through out the day with out it getting super wet between changes. Just wipe it out and its ready. I really enjoy the solid colors and the fun print designs they have. They are a must have if you are doing the pre-fold cloth diapering system!!
customer_reviews.author: Fairydazy

customer_reviews.title: Best cover I have found
customer_reviews.text: Best cover that I have found. Only issue I have found is there is a tag on the back that if it gets wet it easily soaked through and gets my baby's back wet. He is a very heavy wetter and he only gets wet when he sleeps longer than 6 hours during the night in this cover. Other covers we have tried he has wet through them in 20 minutes during the day. We haven't had any poop outside the cover yet and he has had some big messes inside the cover. Overall a great buy for a diaper cover using a reusable liner
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nautical color is not like the picture
customer_reviews.text: I just received the diaper and I'm highly disappointed in the color. It is not the same as the picture. The stock photo is a darker blue and what they sent is a brighter blue. If I would have known that I would not have ordered this color. I have no problem with the product though other than the color it is as described
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cloth diaper service
customer_reviews.text: The Rumparooz are my favorite shell to use with the flat cotton diapers I get from my diaper service. We've tried several others and I prefer the Rumparooz because they have a great fit with many size options using the different snaps, material that's easy to wipe off for minor messes, and cute colors. Other shells stain more easily and don't fit as snugly. I think they're worth the money if you're using a diaper service!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Thirsties, but Not for Me
customer_reviews.text: After trying diaper covers and pocket diapers, I personally prefer the pocket ones. This cover is better than other brands like Thirsties, but I still had problems with leakage. It may be due to the fact that I was new to the cloth diapering and didn't have my prefolds on correctly; I don't know. But if you prefer diaper covers, I would definitely recommend this over Thirsties.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMama89

customer_reviews.title: Love these diaper covers!
customer_reviews.text: These diaper covers are great! They fit wonderfully, are waterproof and attractive. My newborn's grown exponentially the last 6 weeks and they have fit great so far to accommodate her growing body. I'm sure they'll continue to fit until she's ready for potty training. They also keep the moisture in very well, unless you leave them on for longer than 4 hours. In between changes they can be wiped dry, unless of course your little one has a blow out like my little one does sometimes after which they need a real wash. They also come in several great colors. Can't recommend these covers enough.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline M. Mwaniki

customer_reviews.title: Best Newborn Cover
customer_reviews.text: I have used many many different covers for my 3 children in cloth diapers. These are the best newborn covers! They fit the skinny newborn legs and grow well with the babies through at least 15 lbs. My 18 pound daughter was able to wear this cover. I prefer the snaps over the hook and loop closure. I use these with prefolds, fitteds, and flats. I love the double gussets and the elastic around the front waist. The front waist elastic is great for all ages but especially when you're trying to keep from irritating the umbilical cord.
customer_reviews.author: Marianna Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Stupid place to put something that doesn't even need to ...
customer_reviews.text: I took a star off for the label on the back. It's stitched onto the PUL, and pee seeps through. Stupid place to put something that doesn't even need to be there. After 10 or 15 times through the washer and dryer the stitch holes seem to have closed up and it doesn't leak anymore. Other than that they're great. The newborn size worked well on our daughter when she was 7 lbs and at 11 lbs she still has plenty of room to grow.The cloth diaper she was wearing just had a blowout and the gussets in this cover held it all in. Pretty good cover.
customer_reviews.author: anon576

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown
customer_reviews.text: That beautiful dusky navy color shown in the picture is nothing close to the very bright diaper cover that arrived. I was super bummed that the color wasn’t even close. EDIT: down to one star after two snaps ripped out after only two months of light use. Back to wool and thirsties covers, which have never ripped on me.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Cute, Durable, Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for 2 babies now and they still look practically brand new! Since they are the newborn covers they only fit our kiddos up until about 3-4 months old, but we are glad we invested in these as well as the one size covers because these definitely gave us a better fit for those first few months than the one size covers would have.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Fennell

customer_reviews.title: We <3 Rumparooz!
customer_reviews.text: We've used Rumparooz OS covers since my youngest was a few days old (he was 9lbs, 13oz and 21"). The double gussets are a must have for that runny newborn poop, the prints are adorable, and the craftsmanship is superb. We just recently semi-retired our first Rumparooz cover (baby is 19 months and still in the 98th percentile for weight) after he lost a rise snap while sliding out of my bed (the snap caught on my bed frame). These are also my favorite overnight PUL covers, because they accommodate all of the cloth that my heavy wetter needs to make it 12-14 hours at night.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Such a wonderful cover!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love love these covers! I use them with a prefold and they are amazing! I won't use any others at night time-add a prefold and a bamboo insert and we are g2g, the double gussets at the legs mean for sure NO leaks! My poor baby has had diarrhea for 2 days and We have kept him in a pre-fold with this cover and swapped out the pre-fold quite regularly without having to worry about swapping the cover because it doesn't absorb anything! I have 3 and plan on getting more asap!
customer_reviews.author: Kassie

customer_reviews.title: Good option when Baby is small
customer_reviews.text: I initially found one of these covers second hand and it became my favorite so we purchased two more new. Very happy with these for our little one when he was too small for one size covers of other brands. Didn’t have many leaks at all though we change diapers frequently. I think some leaks are inevitable, but they did a good job of containing most blowouts, and the double leg gussets are great.
customer_reviews.author: M H

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but small on my toddler
customer_reviews.text: The quality seemed really nice on these, but I had to return them as the inner leg was too small for my toddler. He doesn't really have chunky legs, so I was a bit surprised. I love the double gusset, we had the rumparooz pocket diapers and they fit great. Maybe if he was younger it would be a better fit. Snaps worked great and Pul is nice.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Leaks in back around label
customer_reviews.text: There is a huge design flaw in this product where the label is stitched on through the waterproof fabric so wet diapers leak in the back. It was one of the few covers that fit when baby was 9lbs and seemed like it would grow with him, so very disappointed but we can't justify using these covers anymore with so many leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dahlberg

customer_reviews.title: Love this pattern - I didn't notice in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Love this pattern - I didn't notice in the picture, but the snaps are all different colors which is really cute. Rumparooz are my favorite diaper cover (we also use Thirsties Duo Wrap and Blueberry Coveralls) - I had read some reviews about the Rumparooz cautioning about possible leakage due to tag stitching on the rear, but we have had ZERO issues with Rumparooz - no leaks (knock on wood) and we've had some really messy diapers. The pattern options are super cute, and the fit is great. Snap placement is also much better than Thirsties (vertical instead of horizontal).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the fit...
customer_reviews.text: For us the Rumparooz are just okay. My 8 week old is a little chunky and this brand fits him the worst of the three we own (Rumparooz, Best Bottom, and Thirsties). In order to get a good fit in the front of the diaper, the back gets too tight and digs into him leaving red marks. These are also the bulkiest of the three. I will say they also seem to be the largest so they will probably last my son longer than the other diapers. Also, the double gussets have held back his breastmilk poop with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Never leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these covers at first, because I thought they were bulky when my babe was small. But now she is chunky and long, and they fit better than any of my others. Some covers seem a little short, even on the last rise, but these ones aren't. And they have plenty of room to contain all the fluff. Also they are the only diaper I have that has never had a leak or a blowout. When I need something really reliable this cover is what I grab.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Alaine

customer_reviews.title: which is great! Over all I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: These are okay, they definitely do the job! But the snaps are kind of difficult, I wish I would have gone with Velcro. It does fit under the umbilical stump, which is great! Over all I'm impressed, but if I had to do it over again I would have bought less rumparooz and more sweet peas
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Don't order this particular color
customer_reviews.text: Love these covers but this particular color seems to have issues the area around the tag stitches leak and stitching around legs slowly wicks onto fabric.. don't have this issue with other colors so maybe a bad batch of plu
customer_reviews.author: Whitney S.

customer_reviews.title: If you're debating between this and a Flip, buy Rumparooz!
customer_reviews.text: These are so adorable and well made. To my surprise, the outside of this particular cover has a softness about it that I haven't noticed before on other PUL, and I liked it very much! I just wish this was as roomy as a blueberry coverall or an Imagine diaper cover. For what this is though, as well constructed as it is, and as beautiful cover as it is, I would be this cover before a lot of others. If you're debating between this and a Flip, buy Rumparooz!!! The Flip diapers in my experience are nowhere near as well made as this.
customer_reviews.author: TangerineBlissMama

customer_reviews.title: By far the best!
customer_reviews.text: While many other other diapers have an absorbent fabric around the leg openings, these do not....which means you are not faced with blow outs. These are by far the best outers for our baby, from the 4 brands we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Pentimento

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful cover, but delaminating after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This cover is adorable! And itygenerously sized to grow with your baby. However, after about 6 minths of use, rotating with 5-6 other covers, the PUL is delaminating. I am really bummed because I love this cover! I have another Rumparooz cover (solid color) that hasn’t done this. Maybe it’s the outer material on this one causing the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly

customer_reviews.title: They are great for keeping the mess in with the leg gussets
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of the Rumparooz diaper covers!! They are great for keeping the mess in with the leg gussets. They are easy to clean and fast drying and not as bulky as the competitors. The best thin about them is you can use the same one through out the day with out it getting super wet between changes. Just wipe it out and its ready. I really enjoy the solid colors and the fun print designs they have. They are a must have if you are doing the pre-fold cloth diapering system!!
customer_reviews.author: Fairydazy

customer_reviews.title: A little pricy, but super cute
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this cover gets 4 stars is the price. You can get other covers for cheaper and they come with inserts (check out Econobum). I got a couple of these covers because the designs are just so cute (and many are unisex), and I thought it would be a fun addition to the cloth collection. The covers are very adjustable and the quality is great. They are so fancy, you kind of feel like they are just for special occasions. I have enjoyed using these and have been pleased with both the design and functionality. They just aren't very economical.
customer_reviews.author: Swedisheik

customer_reviews.title: Personal favorite
customer_reviews.text: My favorite diaper covers. I started using them when my baby was 4 months so I can't say how it would fit a newborn but I love them for my baby. I have been using them for about 8 months now I like that the piping is not white so no poop stains. Very easy to wipe down and the piping doesn't feel as wet as quickly as the thirtsies brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and great price!
customer_reviews.text: I love these covers they fit my son pretty decent at 10 lb right now. I use them with prefolds. I had the newborn version for when he was smaller and I love those as well. I haven't had any issues with"leaking" however I have had the top edging wick urine once when his diaper was overdue for a change, but that was my fault for not changing him sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We like the comfort and ease of use of the econobum ...
customer_reviews.text: These covers were purchased after having two of the econobum covers. We like the comfort and ease of use of the econobum covers but these no matter how you snap them, are far too tight. I think that it's due to the double gusset but it leaves marks on the babies legs. They are 4 month old twins weighing around 10 lbs. They don't have overly chunky legs either. Don't like them much. They also seem like they will be far too hot for warm months. It's like a thick vinyl car seat cover. The econobum are more breathable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Laura O

customer_reviews.title: Snaps are really difficult! Great cover though.
customer_reviews.text: I did not actually get to use this but bought it and returned it due to the snaps. The snaps were so hard to pull off that I thought the material was going to tear. The cover itself looks great and better than most. I would recommend buying the same cover but with the velcro instead of snaps.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof!!! & Easier than pocket diapers.
customer_reviews.text: These things are so great! I got a bunch of pocket cloth diapers from someone but I waaaay prefer these diaper covers with prefolds, they don’t require all the diaper stuffing and they are way more leak proof. It took me a while to figure out the best folding and snapping technique but now it’s easy and fast to change. I use one cover about 5 times before changing it out to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M. Budinick

customer_reviews.title: great covers!
customer_reviews.text: We baught the newborn size first because I tend to have smaller babies. At 2 months he was quickly outgrowing them but still not fitting in the onesize covers we had already from previous babies. So we took a bit of a chance on these that he would fit better in them, and he did. We like the double gusset and the softness of the edges and outside,
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and fit.
customer_reviews.text: I loved using these diaper covers for my newborn! We were new to cloth diapering and I had initually purchased Alvababy covers. They did not work for our small girl, who was 5 lbs at birth with skinny legs. I ordered 3 of these covers to use over a cotton fitted diaper and they worked so much better. We had no issues with gaps around her skinny legs and the overall fit was great. After a month and a half of use, we have had only a few leaks and she has now outgrown them. They wash easily and feel so soft and high quality. I want to buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Bulky, but well made
customer_reviews.text: At first I was disappointed in how bulky these look, but that is my only possible complaint. They are very well made. the elastic is stronger and the material is thicker than the other diapers I have tried so far. This was among my first order of cloth diapers when my little one was about 10 weeks old. They fit her without any leaks or irritation, but you can not fit new born clothing over this diaper. I had to put her in 0-3 mo or 3 mo onsies and pants and it looks really ridiculous. I have started using these at night because of how much you can fit in them and that works great!
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Audra

customer_reviews.title: Love the Clyde pattern especially
customer_reviews.text: Love the Clyde pattern especially, and the covers are GREAT. We also use Thirsties Duo Wrap, which I no longer like compared to the Rumparooz. With the Thirsties, we have staining issues (on the white gusset trim), and we've had leaks and blow outs. Knock on wood, but we've had NO issues with Rumparooz - I had read a review about the stitching on the Rumparooz label causing leakage, but we've never experienced that and we've had some messy diapers to deal with. The snaps are also a much higher quality and better configuration on the Rumparooz.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite covers!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better quality diaper covers I've had. I love the design and the material is thick. Because of the leg gussets, we haven't had any issues with leaks, even with fluffy overnight-stuffed diapers. I will definitely purchase Rumparooz again. It fits perfectly on the lowest rise setting when our daughter was born (7#) and continues to fit now that she's 2 months. I expect we'll continue to be able to use this cover until she's 4 months or so (with the nighttime diapers that are much thicker than what we use for daytime).
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: Good smaller diaper cover
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than one size diapers but bigger than some newborn diapers. A little big on my 9.5 lbs, 2 week old baby but this cover is good for the weeks befor he fits into one size diapers. Pictures have a bumgenius one size and a newborn diaper for comparison. My baby is currently fitting in newborn disposable diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Lali D.

customer_reviews.title: Fit and double gussets nice for newborn
customer_reviews.text: Fits well for newborn over clotheez workhorse (will be a little chunky compared to a more trim Grovia newborn AIO) and the double gussets are great to catch a dirty diaper the times when using a prefold and it fails or shifts. will be a good transition for a few months until our AI2 or pocket diapers fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Agent Squeegee

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not a great fit for us
customer_reviews.text: I think this diaper style may be more for larger babies. It’s just not able to adjust the way I need it to for my long, thin baby. Also, it’s gray not black.
customer_reviews.author: AHF

customer_reviews.title: She is now 6 weeks old and this has fit her the best since we started cloth when she was about a ...
customer_reviews.text: This quickly became my go to cover for my newborn. She is now 6 weeks old and this has fit her the best since we started cloth when she was about a week old. We have thirsties covers as well which are nice but I liked this one to start off better. The double gussets are awesome at containing breast fed baby poosplosions! I just put a trifolded prefold inside and while it usually gets on the cover if its #2 the cover is very reusable for just #1. I'm very glad I got this cover to get me through the newborn stage until my babe could fit into one size diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good but not our favorite
customer_reviews.text: We've had good luck with the Rumparooz covers and have been using them for over a year. No big issues but I do like the Buttons brand covers better. They fit more trimly and are made of heavier material, which seems to do a better job of containing messes. I recommend trying these and the Buttons covers to see what works best for your family. P.S. I use these covers with the OsoCozy prefolds and they work well.
customer_reviews.author: ForestMama

customer_reviews.title: Liked- but not favorited
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I like Rumparooz covers because they are great at keeping everything in (including breast feed poos) but they have some major downfalls I feel the PUL of this is thiner than some of my other covers. The rise adjusting snaps are difficult. I have to carefully pull them apart because I feel that the PUL will rip apart when unsnapping. These are overpriced. If you were looking for a more budget friendly option, thirsties are my go to cover.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Mom  ïß

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand but received an impersonation
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of cloth diaper because it's easy to change the pads without always changing the diaper (unless its a poop blow out!) But I gave 3 stars because this particular order seemed to be an impersonation/fake Rumparooz. It feels like the fabric is going to rip when unbuttoning the snaps on it and the other Rumparooz we have aren't like that. I would pay close attention to the seller you purchase from.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Cute!!! Don't leak if you change them when you're supposed to!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!!! I only needed to buy 6 covers and a bunch of inexpensive inserts for my one child!! With the pocket diapers I would need at least 25 to last as long! These will hold lots of pee if I use the cotton prefold inserts and the liners to catch most of the poop!! I love that I rarely have to rinse the diaper off in the toilet!! This brand is really great because of the double gusset at the legs!! Plus they are super cute!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Coit

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly not durable
customer_reviews.text: The snaps were far too aggressive. I couldn't unsnap it without using two hands and even so (trying to minimize stress on the fabric) one of the snaps broke through with a single use. The fit was good, but I'm not trying to pay $10 for a single use diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy these when I realized the other brands of newborn diaper covers would be much too large for my 5 1/2 pound baby (as would the diapers, but that's another story.) They are made from a thick, somewhat stretchy fabric. They clean up well, but if you dry them in the dryer make sure you use low heat as the interior is easy to melt. They are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy C.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite newborn covers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend, because these have always been my favorite newborn covers. I love the double elastic at the leg holes and that you can how much you can customize the size. These are also very durable and have held up through several children.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for newborn prefold cover
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for newborn. Super soft! We started using these with prefolds on our not-quite 7 lb baby whose umbilical cord stayed on FOREVER. The notch was perfect as not to disturb that. Now at 3 1/2 months and almost 12 lbs we are still using these at the extended setting and they are working fine.
customer_reviews.author: ARHC

customer_reviews.title: I like the quality of Rumparooz covers
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of Rumparooz covers, inluding the newborn size. The fabric is nice and the double gussets are a good feature. It falls below the belly button on my baby, so its good if you are trying to avoid an umbilical stump. My baby is 10 months old and 20 pounds and can still use this cover on the longest rise and widest waist snaps.
customer_reviews.author: RMX

customer_reviews.title: BEST covers!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite diaper covers! I have 3 of these covers, plus several by other brands, and these are by far my favorites. We use them with OsoCozy Better Fit prefolds, and they work wonderfully. They rarely leak - I'm actually trying to remember the last time we had a leak and I can't - and they look great. The prints are adorable, and the snaps are easy to adjust as my daughter grows. I will be buying more of these soon!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn M.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I had expected.
customer_reviews.text: These diaper covers were everything I had expected. Arrived earlier than expected but still the same quality as orders directly from the website.
customer_reviews.author: EH06

customer_reviews.title: Third ranking diaper cover
customer_reviews.text: Rumparooz is good but i think Blueberry is better. Both do the job but the Rumparooz is tighter around the waist and legs, my little guy always got red marks. But really my #1 diaper cover is definitely wool. Try Babee Greens Merino wool covers. Still holds everything in, is water resistant (and will also absorb moisture if things are really saturated) and they are Breathable. Makes a Huge difference for rash-prone babies and when it's hot out.
customer_reviews.author: KelM

customer_reviews.title: Rumparooz are my second favorite, blueberry coveralls being my first
customer_reviews.text: Rumparooz are my second favorite, blueberry coveralls being my first. Only reason blueberry gets first is because my 6 month only is still in these smallest setting on blueberry cover so I see them fitting him all the way until potty training. Aside from the rumparooz leaving little red marks on his legs it's a great fit and well made cover. I wouldn't recommend for big legged babies they might seem like a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Mae

customer_reviews.title: These are okay. I've been looking for cloth diapers ...
customer_reviews.text: These are okay. I've been looking for cloth diapers for some time now. It didn't come with any inserts, so you'll want to buy these separately. The number of snaps make it a little difficult from an entry-level perspective, but I appreciate that there are so many options to assemble. I can see our kids using these for many years. The quality of the fabric is strong and still soft. The color is very saturated
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Galvez

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These are great for our smaller newborn. She's over 10 pounds now and they still fit, but a little snug. She's soaked through the inserts but nothing leaked out, so that's nice.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof
customer_reviews.text: One of our favorite diaper covers. Double gussets and fit a little wider to fit over those bulky fitteds and prefolds that most covers won't fit over. The only reason I deducted one star is because these look bulky and silly under leggings and tight clothes. We definitely go forkne of our trimmer options for when we get ready and go out in cute clothes but these most definitely have a solid place in the diaper rotation! Never had a leak in these and they are our go to for containing those nasty runny poo diapers. Never had a leak in these ever.
customer_reviews.author: jackilynn

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service! I ordered the wrong color on accident and I was given a refund and told to keep the diaper. Can't beat that! As far as the quality, I can tell this diaper is well made and will last a long while. It's primarily used for night-time over a fitted in my household. That works great, no leaks! It is a one size diaper but I do feel like it's on the small side. It's pretty snug on my 8 month son. I feel that this diaper is a great value for the price. Perfect for budgeting mommas!
customer_reviews.author: the Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Diaper Cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two month old son. It fits him very well, though it seems smaller than other cover/diaper brands we use, so just a heads up for those who have larger chubby babies! For this one we have to use the second rise instead of the third, and leave a few snaps on the waist. It works great, with no leg or waist leaks, and no compression leaks either! I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: A.F.S.

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and well built
customer_reviews.text: I love this print! It’s easy to clean and holds up well for several changes. So far it’s worked for our LO from 7-9 lbs, and promises to work for a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: Colliema

customer_reviews.title: Really cute! Keeps everything in very well. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Really cute! Keeps everything in very well. The first few times I used it, I was afraid i was going to tear the fabric unsnapping it, but the snaps seem to be getting looser
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite covers! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite covers! Great quality, great print and great fit! have been using this on my baby since he was 3 months old..... so almost 9 months on... the double leg gussets are still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for newborn
customer_reviews.text: Used these straight from the hospital as others mentioned the patch in the back can leak. My daughter was 8 pounds 2 ounces
customer_reviews.author: Emmy-lou

customer_reviews.title: Great Colors & Not Bulky
customer_reviews.text: Colors were exactly as expected, and the fabric is nice and thin so it doesn't add any extra bulk to the diaper! I had to change the delivery address at the last second and the seller was very responsive and got the package delivered quickly. I will definitely buy from this seller again. Thank you Lil' Tulip's!
customer_reviews.author: J. Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller babies.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these covers. They worked very well when my daughter was not as chunky. She has gained weight (we struggled keeping weight on) and now the fit is not so good. If you have chunky babies I would not recommend these. If you have average to skinny babies these will work great. They do not have snap in inserts which is a little annoying but because the inserts do move. Other than that they are great and hold everything in. We never had any leaks and we loved the double gusset in the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Patters and Excellent Quality! Over a year and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Almost my entire cloth diaper stash is rumparooz! I've been cloth diapering for a year now and ALL of my rumparooz are still going strong. I've had ZERO issues with stink/stain/leaks or fit issues as my little girl has grown. 4 other diaper brands did not make it this far with me but I continue to buy Rumparooz! Adorable patterns and excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Mae

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful. Thin and breathable. Adjustable snaps. Leak at the back tag, so I don't use them at night.
customer_reviews.author: liberty

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Patters and Excellent Quality! Over a year and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Almost my entire cloth diaper stash is rumparooz! I've been cloth diapering for a year now and ALL of my rumparooz are still going strong. I've had ZERO issues with stink/stain/leaks or fit issues as my little girl has grown. 4 other diaper brands did not make it this far with me but I continue to buy Rumparooz! Adorable patterns and excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Mae

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite diaper covers- the gussets somehow prevent leaks & wicking better than other brands. Cute colors, very adjustable. I have been using for several months and they are still like new (I wash in warm water, always air-dry and they dry super fast).
customer_reviews.author: Baby gear mom

product_meta.title: Rumparooz Newborn Cloth Diaper Cover Snap, Nautical
product_meta.description: Size:Newborn| Color:NauticalThe Rumparooz newborn cloth diaper cover is designed to grow with your baby with 3 adjustable rise settings that are designed to fit your preemie and newborn. Weight range of cover starts at 4 pounds and will fit up to approximately 15 pounds. Rumparooz newborn cloth diaper covers are generously sized and designed to fit over most newborn fitted or prefold diapers. Covers may be used multiple times before washing but should be placed into the laundry if it becomes soiled. Kanga care uses a water resistant polyester TPU which is a solvent-free polyester fabric that has been laminated with a thermoplastic polyurethane using a heat bonding process, not chemicals. This process is low in toxicity and is better for the natural environment then traditional PUL. Wash & care: 1. Cold rinse, no detergent. 2. Hot wash/cold rinse with the suggested amount of detergent (see www.kangacare.com For full list of recommended detergents). Lay flat to dry (diapers dry fast!) all kanga care products are designed and distributed worldwide out of golden, co.
feature_bullets: Newborn / Preemie Cover = 3 Sizes in One! The Rumparooz Newborn / Preemie Diaper Covers have 3 adjustable rise settings that are designed to fit your tiny baby from 4 - 15 lbs; Covers may be used several times before needing to be washed; Snap Closure

specifications.Care instructions: No detergent. 2. Hot Wash / Cold Rinse. Dry low temperature or lay flat to dry; diaper covers dry FAST! See www.kangacare.com for full list of recommended detergents., Wash & Care: 1. Cold rinse
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,541 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
